body.p: With the introduction of SFAS 144, the FASB broadened the scope of a discontinued operation from a ‘segment of a business’ to a ‘component of an entity’. A component is widely drawn, the criterion being that it comprises ‘operations and cash flows that can be clearly distinguished, operationally and for financial reporting purposes, from the rest of the entity’. SFAS 144 states that a component may be a segment, a reporting unit, a subsidiary or an asset group.
